intro: Lippia sidoides, commonly known as Mexican mint or silver mint, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a silver-gray underside. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in clusters, which are usually pink or purple in color. It is often used in traditional medicine for its aromatic properties and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant. Lippia sidoides thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it adaptable to various garden environments.
